title: Ainu Association of Hokkaido
text:
The is an umbrella group of which most <a href="Hokkaid%C5%8D">Hokkaidō</a> <a href="Ainu%20people">Ainu</a> and some other Ainu are members. Originally controlled by the <a href="Politics%20of%20Japan">government</a> with the intention of speeding Ainu assimilation and integration into the <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="nation%20state">nation state</a>, it now operates independently of the government and is run exclusively by Ainu.
It was established in 1930 under the name . Since 1961 "utari" has been used instead of "Ainu". The group has been influential in raising public awareness of Ainu issues. The organization's name was changed back to Hokkaido Ainu Association in early 2009. From 1964 to 1996, its executive director was <a href="Giichi%20Nomura">Giichi Nomura</a>.
